channel.title: Reuters: World News
channel.description: Reuters.com is your source for breaking news, business, financial and investing news, including personal finance and stocks. Reuters is the leading global provider of news, financial information and technology solutions to the world's media, financial institutions, businesses and individuals.
channel.copyright: All rights reserved. Users may download and print extracts of content from this website for their own personal and non-commercial use only. item.title: Al Qaeda operational commander killed in U.S. air strike: Pentagon
item.description: ERBIL, Iraq (Reuters) - A U.S. air strike in Afghanistan has killed a high-ranking al Qaeda operational commander, the U.S. military said on Friday.

item.title: Hungary expects to complete Serbian border fence by November: lawmaker
item.description: BUDAPEST (Reuters) - Hungary expects to complete a four-meter-high (12 feet) fence along its border with Serbia by November to stem the flow of tens of thousands of illegal migrants, a top ruling-party lawmaker was quoted as saying.

item.title: Pentagon chief flies into Iraqi Kurdistan, to meet Barzani
item.description: ERBIL, Iraq (Reuters) - U.S. Defense Secretary Ash Carter arrived on an unannounced visit on Friday to Erbil, capital of Iraq's Kurdistan region whose forces have emerged as one of America's strongest partners in the fight against Islamic State.

item.title: Malaysia's home ministry suspends publications over 1MDB reports
item.description: KUALA LUMPUR (Reuters) - The Malaysian government's crackdown on the media and dissenters widened on Friday, as the home ministry suspended the publishing permit of The Edge Weekly and The Edge Financial Daily for three months over their reporting of an alleged graft scandal.

item.title: China police arrest two 'violent terrorists' in coastal city
item.description: BEIJING (Reuters) - Chinese authorities in the eastern coastal city of Wenzhou have arrested two "violent terrorists", state media reported on Friday, and accused them of being part of a criminal gang in the city.

item.title: China says has every right to drill in East China Sea
item.description: BEIJING (Reuters) - China said on Friday it had every right to drill in the East China Sea close to waters disputed with Japan, adding that it did not recognize a "unilateral" Japanese median line setting out a boundary between the two in the waters.

item.title: Turkish jets hit Islamic State positions in Syria: PM's office
item.description: ANKARA (Reuters) - Turkish fighter jets pounded Islamic State targets in Syria early on Friday, the prime minister's office said, after Turkey said it would take any "necessary measures" to protect itself from Islamist and Kurdish militant attacks.

item.title: Detained Chinese lawyers admit guilt in disorder charges: state media
item.description: (This version of the July 19th story corrects throughout to reflect no formal charges have been filed,and not all accused work for law firm)

item.title: Thailand indicts 72 human trafficking suspects ahead of U.S. report
item.description: BANGKOK (Reuters) - Thailand on Friday indicted 72 people suspected of involvement in human trafficking, just days before the United States issues its latest assessment of the country's anti-trafficking efforts next week.

item.title: Kerry: critics of Iran deal spinning 'fantasy,' urges approval
item.description: WASHINGTON (Reuters) - U.S. Secretary of State John Kerry on Thursday mounted a furious counterattack against critics of the Iran nuclear deal, telling skeptical lawmakers it would be fantasy to think the United States could simply "bomb away" Tehran's atomic know-how.

item.title: Australian nurse who aided ISIS heading home, could face arrest
item.description: SYDNEY (Reuters) - An Australian nurse alleged to have given medical assistance to Islamic State militants fighting in Syria could face arrest for violating tough new security laws when he lands in Sydney on Friday, police and officials said.

item.title: Defense gets access to evidence for DNA tests in Thailand backpackers murder trial: lawyer
item.description: BANGKOK (Reuters) - A Thai court has given defense lawyers access to evidence for DNA testing in the trial of two Myanmar workers accused of murdering two British tourists in Thailand, a defense lawyer said on Friday.

item.title: Laws passed, Greece to open bailout talks as recession pushes goals further
item.description: ATHENS/BRUSSELS (Reuters) - Greece's creditors prepared on Thursday for the start of bailout talks in Athens, after lawmakers adopted a second package of reform measures before dawn despite a left wing rebellion that may bring early elections.

item.title: Damning report on missing Mexican students says 'justice neglected'
item.description: MEXICO CITY (Reuters) - An independent Mexican commission said on Thursday it found serious flaws in an investigation into the apparent massacre of 43 students last year, dealing a fresh blow to President Enrique Pena Nieto over a scandal that has battered his administration.

item.title: Two killed in new push by Libya's eastern government forces in Benghazi
item.description: BENGHAZI, Libya (Reuters) - Two Libyan soldiers were killed and 10 wounded on Thursday when eastern government forces made a new push against Islamist fighters in the embattled center of Benghazi, medics said.

item.title: French constitutional body approves eavesdropping law
item.description: PARIS (Reuters) - France's Constitutional Council on Thursday broadly approved a law giving state intelligence services more scope to eavesdrop on the public to tackle what authorities have described as an unprecedented terror threat.

item.title: Academics, activists eye seats in parliament to curb Myanmar military
item.description: YANGON (Reuters) - Leading activists and academics in Myanmar are rallying behind opposition leader Aung San Suu Kyi ahead of Nov. 8 parliamentary elections, hoping that a resounding win for her party will help force the military to loosen its grip on power.

item.title: Cartoon capers: Japan PM uses offbeat PR blitz to rescue ratings
item.description: TOKYO (Reuters) - Japanese Prime Minister Shinzo Abe is using 'anime' cartoons, Internet chats and even an unusual show-and-tell TV appearance, complete with a mockup of burning buildings, in an effort to persuade wary voters that his bolder defense policy makes sense.

item.title: Turkish army returns fire on Islamic State after soldier killed: officials
item.description: ANKARA/BEIRUT (Reuters) - Turkish forces returned fire on Islamic State militants in Syria with tank shells on Thursday after a Turkish soldier was killed and two others were wounded in a cross-border firefight, military and government officials said.

item.title: Turkey lets U.S. strike Islamic State from Incirlik base: U.S.
item.description: WASHINGTON (Reuters) - Turkey has agreed to allow U.S. planes to launch air strikes against Islamic State militants from the U.S. air base at Incirlik, close to the Syrian border, U.S. defense officials said on Thursday.
